gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.intro: Welcome to the admin dashboard! Here's a quick guide to get you started.

step1.title: 1. Set up categories
step1.description: Create event categories to organize your events effectively. Categories help visitors filter and find events they're interested in.

step2.title: 2. Create your first event
step2.description: Add events with details, images, and categories. Events are the heart of your platform - make them engaging!

step3.title: 3. Manage users
step3.description: Invite team members and assign appropriate roles (Admin, Editor, or Viewer) based on their responsibilities.

step4.title: 4. Upload media
step4.description: Use the media library to manage images for events, gallery albums, and other content throughout your site.

categories.title: Managing Categories
categories.q1: How do I create a new category?
categories.a1: Go to Categories > Click 'New Category' > Enter name, choose a color and icon > Save. Categories help organize your events.
categories.q2: Why can't I delete a category?
categories.a2: Categories with associated events cannot be deleted. First, reassign or delete those events, then you can delete the category.
categories.q3: What's the best way to organize categories?
categories.a3: Keep categories broad and intuitive. Use 5-10 main categories that clearly represent different types of events (e.g., Fundraising, Community, Education).

events.title: Managing Events
events.q1: How do I make an event featured?
events.a1: When creating or editing an event, check the 'Featured Event' checkbox. Featured events appear prominently on the homepage.
events.q2: Can I schedule events to publish later?
events.a2: Yes! Set the event date in the future and it will automatically appear in the appropriate upcoming events section.
events.q3: What image size is recommended for events?
events.a3: We recommend 1200x630 pixels for event images. This ensures they look great across all devices.

users.title: User Management
users.q1: What's the difference between user roles?
users.a1: Admin: Full access. Editor: Can manage content but not users/settings. Viewer: Read-only access for monitoring.
users.q2: How do I reset a user's password?
users.a2: Edit the user and enter a new password in the password field. Leave blank to keep the current password.
users.q3: Can I deactivate a user without deleting them?
users.a3: Yes! Toggle the 'Active' switch off. The user account remains but they can't log in until reactivated.

media.title: Media Library
media.a1: Images: JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP. We recommend JPG for photos and PNG for graphics with transparency.
media.q2: Is there a file size limit?
media.a2: Maximum 10MB per file. For best performance, optimize images before uploading using tools like TinyPNG.
media.q3: How do I organize my media?
media.a3: Use descriptive filenames before uploading. The media library shows the most recent uploads first.
